message.content:
Sure, I'd be happy to help you with that! Here is a healthy meal plan for seven days that excludes the foods you mentioned:

Day 1: Breakfast - Oatmeal with fruit and nuts; Lunch - Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, veggies, and a homemade vinaigrette; Dinner - Baked salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa

Day 2: Breakfast - Smoothie made with banana, spinach, and almond milk; Lunch - Turkey and avocado wrap with mixed greens and a side of carrot sticks; Dinner - Stir-fry with tofu, brown rice, and mixed veggies

Day 3: Breakfast - Whole grain waffles with fresh berries and yogurt; Lunch - Grilled chicken breast with roasted sweet potatoes and steamed broccoli; Dinner - Slow cooker lentil soup with kale and quinoa

Day 4: Breakfast - Scrambled eggs with spinach, tomatoes, and whole grain toast; Lunch - Tuna salad sandwich with mixed greens and a side of cucumber slices; Dinner - Grilled shrimp with zucchini noodles and cherry tomatoes

Day 5: Breakfast - Greek yogurt with granola and fruit; Lunch - Chicken Caesar salad with romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, and a homemade Caesar dressing; Dinner - Baked chicken breast with roasted asparagus and brown rice

Day 6: Breakfast - Omelette made with egg whites, spinach, and mushrooms; Lunch - Turkey and cheese wrap with mixed greens and a side of apple slices; Dinner - Grilled steak with roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet potato fries

Day 7: Breakfast - Whole grain pancakes with fresh berries and yogurt; Lunch - Chicken quesadilla with mixed greens, avocado, and a side of sliced cucumbers; Dinner - Baked cod with roasted carrots and quinoa

I hope this meal plan helps you stay healthy and satisfied!
